page.title: 07Birds Hill - my Walk
page.content: First we stopped in Monksilver at the Notley Arms. We walked to the Old School House. We walked up Birds Hill then we stopped at the top of the hill and looked down at the view. We collected samples and took some {photographs}and did some{sketching. From its summit you can see that this is one of the{highest points around Monksilver. We could see that Birds Hill is covered with{deciduous trees. Looking towards{Minehead}you can see the variety of the land cover. Some of the fields are brown and ploughed, others are green with{cereal {crops or silage}showing this to be an arable farming area . But this land cover is only predominant in the low valley areas. Lee Montgomery aged 12
